reading_passages.title: About Eastern Europe
reading_passages.text: Lesson 1 Big Idea The physical geography of Eastern Europe varies greatly from place to place. Main Ideas •The physical features of Eastern Europe include wide open plains, rugged mountain ranges, and many rivers.
reading_passages.main_idea: Lesson 1 Big Idea The physical geography of Eastern Europe varies greatly from place to place.
supporting_details: Main Ideas •The physical features of Eastern Europe include wide open plains, rugged mountain ranges, and many rivers.

reading_passages.title: About Eastern Europe
reading_passages.text: The climate and vegetation of Eastern Europe differ widely in the North and the South. Lesson 2 Big Idea The histories of Poland and the Baltic Republics, both as free states and as areas dominated by the Soviet Union, still shape life there. Main Ideas •History ties Poland and the Baltic Republics together.
reading_passages.main_idea: The climate and vegetation of Eastern Europe differ widely in the North and the South.
supporting_details: Lesson 2 Big Idea The histories of Poland and the Baltic Republics, both as free states and as areas dominated by the Soviet Union, still shape life there.
Main Ideas •History ties Poland and the Baltic Republics together.

reading_passages.title: About Eastern Europe
reading_passages.text: Lesson 3 Big Idea The countries of inland Eastern Europe have varied histories and cultures but face many of the same issues today. Main Ideas •The histories and cultures of inland Eastern Europe vary from country to country.
reading_passages.main_idea: Lesson 3 Big Idea The countries of inland Eastern Europe have varied histories and cultures but face many of the same issues today.
supporting_details: Main Ideas •The histories and cultures of inland Eastern Europe vary from country to country.

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Climate
scientific_phenomena.description: The climate and vegetation of Eastern Europe differ widely in the North and the South. Lesson 2 Big Idea The histories of Poland and the Baltic Republics, both as free states and as areas dominated by the Soviet Union, still shape life there. Main Ideas •History ties Poland and the Baltic Republics together.
observation_prompts: What features of climate can you identify in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.description: Discuss that these differences occur mainly because Eastern Europe has many different landforms, water features, and climates.

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Mountain
scientific_phenomena.description: Then ask them what impact mountainous terrain might have on the governments and peoples of the region. Culture Ask students what positive and negative aspects might come from having cultures with varied customs, beliefs, and languages within a region. Geography Rivers have been important for transportation and trade across Eastern Europe.

scientific_phenomena.description: golden-green ocean, ” “the yellow broom, ” “the parasol-shaped white flower, ” “notes of a thousand different birds”).

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Ocean
scientific_phenomena.description: The whole surface resembled a golden-green ocean, upon which were sprinkled millions of different flowers. Through the tall, slender stems of the grass peeped light-blue, dark-blue, and lilac star-thistles; the yellow broom thrust up its pyramidal head; the parasol- shaped white flower of the false flax shimmered on high. A wheat-ear, brought God knows whence, was filling out to ripening.
observation_prompts: What features of ocean can you identify in Eastern Europe?
How might ocean affect people living in Eastern Europe?
What patterns do you notice about ocean in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Weather
scientific_phenomena.description: variation in climate within the interior plains region; colder, wetter climate in the north and milder, drier weather in the south ONLINE INTERACTIVE VISUALS Carousel: Physical Features of Eastern Europe Have students navigate through the carousel and note similarities and differences among the images or identify a unifying theme. You may wish to use the associated question as a discussion prompt. Analyze Visuals What physical features do you see in the photos?
observation_prompts: What features of weather can you identify in Eastern Europe?
How might weather affect people living in Eastern Europe?
What patterns do you notice about weather in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Weather
scientific_phenomena.description: Presentations should include pointing out the major landforms of the area on the map, giving a weather forecast for each season of the year, suggesting what kind of outdoor clothing is appropriate for the area’s climate, and describing the vegetation visitors might see walking or biking through the area.
observation_prompts: What features of weather can you identify in Eastern Europe?
How might weather affect people living in Eastern Europe?
What patterns do you notice about weather in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Environment
scientific_phenomena.description: To meet European Union environmental standards, Poland began working to clean up the Vistula and other rivers, a costly process that will still take many years.

scientific_phenomena.description: Analyze Visuals What precautions are the scientists taking to protect themselves from radiation in the environment? Possible answer: The scientists are wearing protective masks, hazardous material suits, and gloves. c.

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Water
scientific_phenomena.description: largest river in region, connects cities of the region and empties into the sea at a warm water port; provides outlet for trade; provides hydroelectricity Make Inferences Why might the Black Sea be a better route for trade and transportation than the Baltic Sea? Its southerly location makes the Black Sea accessible year-round.
observation_prompts: What features of water can you identify in Eastern Europe?
How might water affect people living in Eastern Europe?
What patterns do you notice about water in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Water
scientific_phenomena.description: During nearly 45 years of Communist rule, the river became very polluted, passing through many cities and areas where pollutants were being discharged directly into the water. In farming areas, fertilizer runoff entered the water. To meet European Union environmental standards, Poland began working to clean up the Vistula and other rivers, a costly process that will still take many years.
observation_prompts: What features of water can you identify in Eastern Europe?
How might water affect people living in Eastern Europe?
What patterns do you notice about water in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Forest
scientific_phenomena.description: coastlines, mountains, rivers, forests ONLINE INTERACTIVE MAPS Eastern Europe: Physical Have students explore the map using the interactive features and answer the associated questions. Location What large river flows through the southern part of the region?
observation_prompts: What features of forest can you identify in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Forest
scientific_phenomena.description: Balkan Peninsula Analyze Why are forests more common in the Baltic region than in the Balkan Peninsula? Balkan Peninsula is much drier Cause and Effect Why do the interior plains have more varied vegetation than other parts of Eastern Europe? variation in climate within the interior plains region, with colder, wetter climate in the north and milder, drier weather in the south More About .
observation_prompts: What features of forest can you identify in Eastern Europe?

scientific_phenomena.title: Eastern Europe Desert
scientific_phenomena.description: Discuss with students that some regions, such as large deserts, have fairly consistent features. Others, like Eastern Europe, vary greatly from one place to another. Ask: What causes these variations?
observation_prompts: What features of desert can you identify in Eastern Europe?
How might desert affect people living in Eastern Europe?
What patterns do you notice about desert in Eastern Europe?

writing_prompts: Using information from the passage and your own knowledge, write an informative paragraph about Eastern Europe. Include at least three vocabulary terms from Part 1.
Describe an important geographic feature of Eastern Europe and explain its significance to the region.
Compare and contrast two aspects of Eastern Europe discussed in the reading passage.
reflection_questions: What new information did you learn about Eastern Europe?
What questions do you still have about Eastern Europe?
How does learning about Eastern Europe help you understand our world better?
How might life in Eastern Europe be similar to or different from your own?

system_identification.title: HUMAN GEOGRAPHY SYSTEMS
system_identification.instructions: Label each description with the correct human geography system: Urban, Cultural, Economic, Political, or Infrastructure.
